title: Lake Mead National Recreation Area: Guided Tours
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Things To Do     Guided Tours              Guided Tours              The National Park Service presents a variety of ranger-led programs throughout the year. The programs are presented at different locations in Lake Mead National Recreation Area (NRA) ranging from Meadview to Boulder Beach to Katherine Landing.        Get More Information About Our Ranger Led Events: Ranger Events Page  XX Lake Mead Calendar     Interpretive Ranger Programs Remember: Being safe while having fun means being prepared. Bring plenty of water (2 liters or more), appropriate gear such as hats, sunglasses, sunscreen, and extra layers; a lunch for longer hikes, and accessories such as a camera or binoculars if desired.     Lake Mead The National Park Service presents a variety of guided hikes throughout the fall and winter, depending on staffing. These programs occur at different locations in Lake Mead NRA. For more information and reservations, call the Lake Mead Visitor Center at (702)293-8990, Wednesday through Sunday, 9 a.m. to 4 p.m.  Reservations are required.      Lake Mohave The National Park Service presents a variety of guided hikes throughout the fall and winter season, depending on staffing. Hikes depart at different times and locations in Lake Mead NRA, Mohave District. For more information and reservations, call the Lake Mead Visitor Center at (702) 293-8990, Wednesday through Sunday, 9 a.m. to 4 p.m.  Reservations are required for all hike programs.
